page.title: 15Water Supply to Berwick.
page.content: {Murton Bore-Hole. } The town of Berwick-upon-Tweed and areas immediately surrounding it are supplied with water pumped either simultaneously or separately from the Murton bore-hole and the Thornton bore-hole. Thornton bore-hole lies to the South of our area. The water comes from a subterranean lake within the sandstone. The Murton bore-hole is 500ft deep and to-gether with Thornton, pumps water into a reservoir at Springhill which holds 750,000 gallons of water.Murton pumps 24 hours a day and on its own can produce 30,000 gallons per hour. Together with Thornton 55,000 gallons per hour can be produced. The water consumption of the town and surrounding area varies according to demand about 900,000 gallons to l.3 million gallons per day.
